com.googlecode.streamflyer.experimental.range

Class RangeFilterModifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.streamflyer.experimental.range.RangeFilterModifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Modifier
    Deprecated. 
    This class is not fully functional yet (look-behind constructs do not work)

    @Deprecated
public class RangeFilterModifier
extends Object
implements Modifier
    This modifier deletes all data from the character stream that is not placed between the given start and end tag. This is a bit similar to Perl's or Ruby's range operator.

    Additionally, you can choose whether the start or end tags shall be removed from the input as well.

    EXAMPLES: These examples show the impact of the parameters includeStart, includeEnd, and initiallyBeforeEnd. 

                      start end   keep  starts original                    modified 
task              tag   tag   tags? open?  input                       input
---------------   ----- ----- ----- ------ --------------------------- --------------
extract text of 
comments          <%    %>    no    no     "my <% comment %> text"     " comment "

extract comment 
tags              <%    %>    yes   no     "my <% comment %> text"     "<% comment %>"

strip comments    %>    <%    no    yes    "my <% comment %> text"     "my  text" 

clear comments    %>    <%    yes   yes     "my <% comment %> text"    "my <%%> text"
    Since:
    13.09.2011
    Author:
    rwoo

    • Constructor Detail

      • RangeFilterModifier

        public RangeFilterModifier(RegexModifier startModifier,
                   RegexModifier endModifier,
                   boolean includeStart,
                   boolean includeEnd,
                   boolean initiallyBeforeEnd)
        Deprecated. 
        The match processor of both given modifiers are replaced with another one. So you don't have to care about the match processor you have used on
        Parameters:
        startModifier - Must not be null.
        endModifier - Must not be null.
        includeStart - True if the start tag shall not be deleted from the input. False if the start tag shall be deleted from the input.
        includeEnd - True if the end tag shall not be deleted from the input. False if the end tag shall be deleted from the input.
        initiallyBeforeEnd - True if the given input shall be parsed assuming the input is prefixed with an end tag. False if the given input shall be parsed assuming the input is prefixed with a start tag.

    • Method Detail

      • modify

        public AfterModification modify(StringBuilder characterBuffer,
                       int firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer,
                       boolean endOfStreamHit)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: Modifier
        Processes the characters in the given character buffer, i.e. deletes or replaces or inserts characters, or keeps the characters as they are.
        Specified by:
        modify in interface Modifier
        Parameters:
        characterBuffer - The next characters provided from the modifiable stream. It contains the modifiable characters, (optionally) preceded by unmodifiable characters.

        The modifier can modify the content of the buffer as appropriate the modifier must not modify the unmodifiable characters, i.e. the characters before position firstModifiableCharacterInBufferIndex must not be modified.

        Your modifier should manage the capacity of the buffer on its own - as the optimal management of the capacity depends on the specific purpose of the modifier.

        The given buffer must be never null.

        firstModifiableCharacterInBuffer - index of the first modifiable character in the buffer. The index of the first character in the buffer is zero. If there is not modifiable character in the buffer, then this value is equal the length of the buffer.
        endOfStreamHit - True if no more characters can be read from the stream, i.e. the character buffer contains the all the characters up to the end of the stream.
        Returns:
        Returns an object that defines how ModifyingReader or ModifyingWriter shall behave before calling Modifier.modify(StringBuilder, int, boolean) again.
        See Also:
        Modifier.modify(java.lang.StringBuilder, int, boolean)
